notes: First-generation BH luxury sedan launched under Hyundai badging for 2009 with rear-wheel drive, ZF 6HP automatic and optional Tau V8 delivering up to 385 hp in North America. 2012 update added in-house 8-speed for the V8, Lexicon audio, and adaptive front lighting that needs calibration after headlamp or bumper work. Data sourced from Wikipedia Hyundai Genesis article, August 1, 2025 revision.

Initial BK1 rear-drive coupe offered turbocharged four-cylinder and 3.8L V6 powertrains with optional Brembo brake package and limited-slip differential. Early automatics used Aisin 5-speed on 2.0T and ZF 6-speed on 3.8, both requiring specific SP-III/SP-IV fluids; long doors and structural braces demand correct lift points. Data sourced from Wikipedia Hyundai Genesis Coupe article, August 4, 2025 revision.
